Class MasterServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • MasterServer
  • public class MasterServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Starting point for all processes that take place on the master server. Initializes resources and creates ClientListener and NodeListener instances to handle connections. This class and the classes it uses will create auth.txt, nodes.txt, masterfiles.txt, and log.txt in this directory and relies on auth.txt, nodes.txt, and masterfiles.txt to function properly.

      Class constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MasterServer

        public MasterServer()
        Class constructor. Creates necessary files if needed and reads in a list of nodes from nodes.txt if it already exists in this directory.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method. Initializes an instance of this class and calls its startServers() method.
        Parameters:
        args - no command line arguments are used

      • startServers

        public void startServers()
        Starts listening for TCP socket connections. Initializes both a ClientListener and a NodeListener to start listening for connections.

      • addNode

        public static void addNode​(java.lang.String nodeID)
        Adds a data node name to the list in nodes.txt file. These names are used like logins when a node connects to the server, allowing data nodes to check for any missing files and retrieve their previous state on reconnection to the master server.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the name of the node to be added to the file

      • formatTime

        public static java.lang.String formatTime​(long timeMillis)
        Formats a time using the standard MasterServer time format.
        Parameters:
        timeMillis - time in milliseconds. Returned by System.currentTimeMillis();
        Returns:
        formatted String of the time represented by the timeMillis argument

      • logEvent

        public static void logEvent​(java.lang.String event,
                            long timeMillis,
                            java.lang.String[] info)
        Logs an event to the log file, log.txt, after formatting the provided information.
        Parameters:
        event - name of event to log
        timeMillis - time of event in milliseconds
        info - any additional information for this log entry
